intro: Moehringia thasia, commonly known as the silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically alternate and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Moehringia thasia is often found in rocky soils and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
